Volodymyr Oleksandrovych Zelenskyy is: Volodymyr Oleksandrovych Zelenskyy is a Ukrainian politician.
Volodymyr Oleksandrovych Zelenskyy is a former entertainer.
Volodymyr Oleksandrovych Zelenskyy has served as the sixth president of Ukraine.
Volodymyr Oleksandrovych Zelenskyy has been the current president of Ukraine since 2019.
Volodymyr Oleksandrovych Zelenskyy took office five years after the start of the Russo-Ukrainian War.
The Russo-Ukrainian War began with Russia's annexation of Crimea and invasion of the Donbas.
Volodymyr Oleksandrovych Zelenskyy has continued to serve during the full-scale Russian invasion of Ukraine.
The full-scale Russian invasion of Ukraine has been ongoing since February 2022.
Zelenskyy grew up as a native Russian sp: Zelenskyy grew up as a native Russian speaker in Kryvyi Rih.
Kryvyi Rih is a major city of Dnipropetrovsk Oblast in central Ukraine.
Zelenskyy obtained a degree in law from the Kryvyi Rih Institute of Economics.
Zelenskyy pursued a career in comedy and entertainment.
Zelenskyy co-created the production company Kvartal 95.
Kvartal 95 produced films, cartoons, and TV shows.
Kvartal 95 produced the TV series Servant of the People.
In the TV series Servant of the People, Zelenskyy played a fictional Ukrainian president.
The TV series Servant of the People aired from 2015 to 2019.
The TV series Servant of the People was immensely popular.
A political party with the same name as the TV show Servant of the People was created in March 2018.
The political party Servant of the People was created by employees of Kvartal 95.
Zelenskyy announced his candidacy in the: Zelenskyy announced his candidacy in the 2019 presidential election on the evening of 31 December 2018.
Zelenskyy's announcement coincided with the New Year's Eve address of then-president Petro Poroshenko.
The announcement was made on the TV channel 1+1.
Zelenskyy positioned himself as an anti-establishment figure.
Zelenskyy positioned himself as an anti-corruption figure.
Zelenskyy had become one of the frontrunners in opinion polls for the election months before he formally declared his candidacy.
Zelenskyy won the election with 73.23 percent of the vote in the second round.
Zelenskyy defeated Poroshenko in the election.
Zelenskyy's victory was the biggest landslide in the history of Ukrainian presidential elections.
As president, Zelenskyy has been a propo: As president, Zelenskyy has been a proponent of e-government.
Zelenskyy has advocated for unity between the Ukrainian- and Russian-speaking parts of Ukraine's population.
Zelenskyy makes extensive use of social media, particularly Instagram.
Zelenskyy's party won a landslide victory in the snap legislative election held shortly after his inauguration as president.
During the first two years of his administration, Zelenskyy oversaw the lifting of legal immunity for members of parliament.
Zelenskyy managed the country's response to the COVID-19 pandemic.
Zelenskyy dealt with the subsequent economic recession following the COVID-19 pandemic.
Zelenskyy made some limited progress in tackling corruption in Ukraine.
A poll in May 2021 by the Rating Group gave Zelenskyy the highest trust rating out of all Ukrainian presidents.
The same poll ranked Zelenskyy as the second-best president after Leonid Kuchma.
During his presidential campaign, Zelens: During his presidential campaign, Zelenskyy promised to end Ukraine's protracted conflict with Russia.
Zelenskyy has attempted to engage in dialogue with Russian president Vladimir Putin.
Zelenskyy's administration faced an escalation of tensions with Russia in 2021.
The escalation of tensions with Russia culminated in Russia's full-scale invasion of Ukraine in February 2022.
Zelenskyy's strategy during the Russian military buildup was to calm the Ukrainian populace.
Zelenskyy assured the international community that Ukraine was not seeking to retaliate.
Zelenskyy initially distanced himself from warnings of an imminent war.
Zelenskyy called for security guarantees and military support from NATO.
Zelenskyy sought NATO's help to 'withstand' the threat.
When Russia launched its full-scale inva: Zelenskyy remained in Kyiv during the invasion.
Zelenskyy declined international offers to evacuate him from Kyiv.
Kyiv was under attack during the invasion.
Zelenskyy declared martial law across Ukraine.
Zelenskyy declared a general mobilisation of the armed forces.
Zelenskyy was named the Time Person of the Year for 2022.
Zelenskyy has frequently visited frontline areas.
Zelenskyy has frequently visited newly liberated areas.
Zelenskyy's term was originally schedule: Zelenskyy's term was originally scheduled to end in May 2024.
The ongoing Russian invasion prevented the regularly scheduled presidential election from being conducted.
The ongoing martial law prevented the regularly scheduled presidential election from being conducted.
Zelenskyy is expected to remain president for the duration of the Russo-Ukrainian War.
Due to the extension of his term, Zelenskyy is the second-longest serving president in Ukrainian history.
Kuchma is the longest-serving president in Ukrainian history.
Volodymyr Oleksandrovych Zelenskyy was b: Volodymyr Oleksandrovych Zelenskyy was born to Jewish parents on 25 January 1978 in Kryvyi Rih.
Kryvyi Rih was then in the Ukrainian Soviet Socialist Republic.
Volodymyr Zelenskyy's father is Oleksandr Zelenskyy.
Oleksandr Zelenskyy is a professor and computer scientist.
Oleksandr Zelenskyy is the head of the Department of Cybernetics and Computing Hardware at the Kryvyi Rih State University of Economics and Technology.
Volodymyr Zelenskyy's mother is Rymma Zelenska.
Rymma Zelenska is a retired engineer.
Volodymyr Zelenskyy's grandfather is Semyon Zelenskyy.
Semyon Zelenskyy served as an infantryman in the Red Army during World War II.
Semyon Zelenskyy reached the rank of colonel in the Red Army.
Semyon Zelenskyy's father and three brothers were killed in the Holocaust.
In March 2022, Zelenskyy said that his great-grandparents had been killed after German troops burned their home to the ground during a massacre.
Volodymyr Zelenskyy's grandmother survived World War II after leaving Kryvyi Rih in an evacuation of Jews to Almaty, Kazakhstan.
Volodymyr Zelenskyy's grandmother returned to Ukraine after World War II.
Before starting elementary school, Zelen: Before starting elementary school, Zelenskyy lived for four years in the Mongolian city of Erdenet.
Zelenskyy's father worked as a mining engineer in Erdenet from the mid-1970s.
Zelenskyy's father helped build a copper mine in Erdenet.
Zelenskyy's father applied his abilities in computer science to mining.
At the age of 16, Zelenskyy took the Test of English as a Foreign Language.
Zelenskyy received an education grant to study in Israel.
Zelenskyy's father did not allow him to go to Israel.
Zelenskyy later earned a law degree from the Kryvyi Rih Institute of Economics.
The Kryvyi Rih Institute of Economics was then a department of Kyiv National Economic University.
The Kryvyi Rih Institute of Economics is now part of Kryvyi Rih National University.
Zelenskyy never worked in the legal field.
At age 17, Zelenskyy joined his local te: At age 17, Zelenskyy joined his local team competing in the KVN comedy competition.
Zelenskyy was soon invited to join the united Ukrainian team 'Zaporizhzhia-Kryvyi Rih-Transit.'
The 'Zaporizhzhia-Kryvyi Rih-Transit' team performed in the KVN's Major League.
The 'Zaporizhzhia-Kryvyi Rih-Transit' team eventually won in 1997.
In 1997, Zelenskyy created and headed the Kvartal 95 team.
Kvartal 95 later transformed into the comedy outfit Kvartal 95.
From 1998 to 2003, Kvartal 95 performed in the Major League of KVN.
Kvartal 95 also performed in the highest open Ukrainian league of KVN from 1998 to 2003.
The team members of Kvartal 95 spent a lot of time in Moscow from 1998 to 2003.
Kvartal 95 constantly toured around post-Soviet countries from 1998 to 2003.
Zelenskyy and Kvartal 95 left KVN in 200: Zelenskyy and Kvartal 95 left KVN in 2003.
Zelenskyy declined a job offer from KVN's Russian management in 2003.
The job offer would have required Zelenskyy to abandon Kvartal 95.
A Russian KVN producer used an antisemitic insult against Zelenskyy on stage.
In 2003, Kvartal 95 started producing TV shows for the Ukrainian TV channel 1+1.
In 2005, Kvartal 95 moved to the Ukrainian TV channel Inter.
In 2008, he starred in the feature film: In 2008, he starred in the feature film Love in the Big City.
He starred in the sequel, Love in the Big City 2.
Zelenskyy continued his movie career with the film Office Romance. Our Time in 2011.
He starred in Rzhevsky Versus Napoleon in 2012.
Love in the Big City 3 was released in January 2014.
Zelenskyy played the leading role in the 2012 film 8 First Dates.
He played the leading role in sequels to 8 First Dates that were produced in 2015 and 2016.
He recorded the voice of Paddington Bear in the Ukrainian dubbing of Paddington.
He recorded the voice of Paddington Bear in the Ukrainian dubbing of Paddington 2.
Zelenskyy was a member of the board and: Zelenskyy was a member of the board of the TV channel Inter from 2010 to 2012.
Zelenskyy was the general producer of the TV channel Inter from 2010 to 2012.
In 2018, Zelenskyy said that then-President Yanukovych had offered him US$100 million for political control of Kvartal 95's programmes.
Zelenskyy became general producer of Inter before Yanukovych's offer.
Zelenskyy refused the US$100 million offer from Yanukovych.
After Russia's 2014 annexation of Crimea: After Russia's 2014 annexation of Crimea, Kvartal 95 closed its office in Moscow.
Kvartal 95 began shutting down business ties with Russia after 2014.
Zelenskyy himself stopped working in Russia by the end of 2014.
By Zelenskyy's estimation, Kvartal 95's average revenue per hour of TV programming reduced from $200,000 to $30,000.
From 2014, Kvartal 95 began visiting the war zone to perform for Ukrainian soldiers at the front.
Ukrainian media reported that Zelenskyy's Kvartal 95 had donated ₴1 million to the Ukrainian army after the start of the Russo-Ukrainian War.
Some Russian politicians and artists petitioned for a ban on Zelenskyy's works in Russia.
In August 2014, Zelenskyy spoke out agai: In August 2014, Zelenskyy spoke out against the intention of the Ukrainian Ministry of Culture to ban Russian artists from Ukraine.
Since 2015, Ukraine has banned some Russian artists and Russian media and art from entering Ukraine.
In 2018, the romantic comedy Love in the Big City 2 starring Zelenskyy was banned in Ukraine.
The film Love in the Big City 2 was banned due to not following the Law of Ukraine 'On Cinematography'.
The film Love in the Big City 2 included a blacklisted Russian actor.
In 2015, Zelenskyy became the star of th: In 2015, Zelenskyy became the star of the television series Servant of the People.
In Servant of the People, Zelenskyy played the role of the president of Ukraine.
In the series, Zelenskyy's character was a high-school history teacher in his 30s.
Zelenskyy's character won the presidential election after a viral video showed him ranting against government corruption in Ukraine.
Zelenskyy co-produced the comedy series Svaty.
The comedy series Svaty was banned in Ukraine in 2017.
The comedy series Svaty was unbanned in Ukraine in March 2019.
In 2016, while he was serving as the Art: In 2016, Zelenskyy was serving as the Artistic Director of Kvartal 95.
In 2016, Zelenskyy was a co-presenter of the Teletriumph Awards.
The Teletriumph Awards are the national television awards of Ukraine.
Zelenskyy co-presented the Teletriumph Awards alongside Masha Efrosynina.
Teletriumph 2016 was held at Freedom Hall.
Zelenskyy had to leave the stage to accept his own award that night.
The television channel Inter, associated with Kvartal 95, boycotted the event.
Inter Media Group, the parent company of Inter, also boycotted the event.
The boycott was due to disputes within the Ukrainian television industry and the awards organizers.
Zelenskyy reportedly delivered a biting punchline about the boycott.
The president of Inter Media Group circulated a press release in response.
Zelenskyy worked mostly in Russian-langu: Zelenskyy worked mostly in Russian-language productions.
Zelenskyy's first role in the Ukrainian language was the romantic comedy 'I, You, He, She'.
'I, You, He, She' appeared on the screens of Ukraine in December 2018.
The first version of the script for 'I, You, He, She' was written in Ukrainian.
The script for 'I, You, He, She' was translated into Russian for the Lithuanian actress Agnė Grudytė.
The movie 'I, You, He, She' was later dubbed into Ukrainian.
In March 2018, members of Zelenskyy's pr: In March 2018, members of Zelenskyy's production company Kvartal 95 registered a new political party called Servant of the People.
The political party Servant of the People shares its name with the television program that Zelenskyy had starred in over the previous three years.
Zelenskyy denied any immediate plans to enter politics.
Zelenskyy stated he registered the party name only to prevent it from being appropriated by others.
There was widespread speculation that Zelenskyy was planning to run for office.
As early as October 2018, Zelenskyy was already a frontrunner in opinion polls.
October 2018 was three months before Zelenskyy's campaign announcement and six months before the presidential election.
After months of ambiguous statements, Zelenskyy announced his candidacy for president of Ukraine on 31 December.
Zelenskyy announced his candidacy on the New Year's Eve evening show on the TV channel 1+1.
Zelenskyy's announcement up-staged the New Year's Eve address of incumbent president Petro Poroshenko on the same channel.
Zelenskyy said the up-staging was unintentional and attributed it to a technical glitch.
Zelenskyy's presidential campaign agains: Zelenskyy's presidential campaign against Poroshenko was almost entirely virtual.
Zelenskyy did not release a detailed policy platform during his campaign.
Zelenskyy's engagement with mainstream media was minimal.
Zelenskyy reached out to the electorate via social media channels and YouTube clips.
In place of traditional campaign rallies, Zelenskyy conducted stand-up comedy routines across Ukraine.
Zelenskyy conducted these comedy routines with his production company Kvartal 95.
On 16 April 2019, 20 Ukrainian news outlets called on Zelenskyy to 'stop avoiding journalists'.
Zelenskyy stated that he was not hiding from journalists.
Zelenskyy stated he did not want to go to talk shows where 'people of the old power' were 'just doing PR'.
Zelenskyy stated he did not have time to satisfy all interview requests.
Zelenskyy styled himself as an anti-esta: Zelenskyy styled himself as an anti-establishment figure.
Zelenskyy styled himself as an anti-corruption figure.
Zelenskyy said he wished to restore trust in politicians.
Zelenskyy aimed to bring professional, decent people to power.
Zelenskyy wanted to change the mood and timbre of the political establishment.
Atlantic Council member Anders Aslund said Zelenskyy was not a populist.
Other scholars have analyzed Zelenskyy's politics in the framework of populism.
Political scientist Volodymyr Kulyk described Zelenskyy as practicing 'inclusionary' populism.
Kulyk's 'inclusionary' populism claims to defend 'the people' against 'the elite'.
Kulyk's definition of 'the people' is inclusive of all ethnic, linguistic, religious, and other groups.
Scholar Kostiantyn Yanchenko described Zelenskyy's campaign as characterized by 'populist hyperreality'.
Yanchenko argued that Zelenskyy's campaign was constructed by the Servant of the People series and Zelenskyy's other comedy shows.
Yanchenko and fellow scholar Mattia Zulianello argued that Zelenskyy and his party were examples of 'valence populism'.
Valence populism focuses on 'non-positional topics, such as anti-corruption appeals, political transparency and moral integrity'.
Valence populism does not focus on 'economic and socio-cultural issues'.
Before the elections, Zelenskyy presente: Before the elections, Zelenskyy presented a team that included former finance minister Oleksandr Danylyuk and others.
During the campaign, concerns were raised over Zelenskyy's links to the oligarch Ihor Kolomoyskyi.
Ihor Kolomoyskyi is a billionaire businessman.
Ihor Kolomoyskyi gained control of the 1+1 Media Group in 2010.
The 1+1 Media Group operates eight Ukrainian TV channels.
The 1+1 Media Group broadcast the Servant of the People TV series from 2015 until 2019.
The Servant of the People TV series featured Zelenskyy playing the President of Ukraine.
Poroshenko and his supporters claimed th: Poroshenko and his supporters claimed that Zelenskyy's victory would benefit Russia.
On 19 April 2019, presidential debates were held at Olimpiyskiy National Sports Complex in the form of a show.
In his introductory speech, Zelenskyy acknowledged that in 2014 he voted for Poroshenko.
Zelenskyy stated, 'I was mistaken. We were mistaken. We voted for one Poroshenko, but received another.'
Zelenskyy claimed that the first Poroshenko appears when there are video cameras.
Zelenskyy claimed that the other Poroshenko sends Medvedchuk privietiki to Moscow.
Zelenskyy initially said he would serve only a single term.
In May 2021, Zelenskyy walked back his promise to serve only a single term, saying he had not yet made up his mind.
Zelenskyy stated that as president he wo: Zelenskyy stated that as president he would develop the economy.
Zelenskyy stated that he would attract investment to Ukraine.
Zelenskyy planned to achieve this through a restart of the judicial system.
Zelenskyy aimed to restore confidence in the state.
Zelenskyy proposed a 5-per-cent flat tax for big business.
The 5-per-cent flat tax could be increased in dialogue with big business and if everyone agrees.
Zelenskyy believed that if people noticed his new government worked honestly from the first day, they would start paying their taxes.
Zelenskyy achieved a plurality of the el: Zelenskyy achieved a plurality of the electorate in the first round of elections on 31 March 2019.
In the second round of elections on 21 April 2019, Zelenskyy received 73 percent of the vote.
Poroshenko received 25 percent of the vote in the second round of elections on 21 April 2019.
Zelenskyy was elected President of Ukraine.
Polish president Andrzej Duda was one of the first European leaders to congratulate Zelenskyy.
French president Emmanuel Macron received Zelenskyy at the Élysée Palace in Paris on 12 April 2019.
On 22 April, U.S. president Donald Trump congratulated Zelenskyy on his victory over the telephone.
European Commission president Jean Claude Juncker and European Council president Donald Tusk issued a joint letter of congratulations to Zelenskyy.
Juncker and Tusk stated that the European Union will work to speed up the implementation of the remainder of the EU-Ukraine Association Agreement.
The EU-Ukraine Association Agreement includes the Deep and Comprehensive Free Trade Area.
In October 2021, the Pandora Papers reve: In October 2021, the Pandora Papers revealed that Zelenskyy, his chief aide, and the head of the Security Service of Ukraine Ivan Bakanov operated a network of offshore companies.
The offshore companies were located in the British Virgin Islands, Cyprus, and Belize.
Some of these companies owned expensive property in London.
Around the time of his 2019 election, Zelenskyy handed his shares in a key offshore company over to Serhiy Shefir.
Zelenskyy and Serhiy Shefir appear to have arranged for Zelenskyy's family to continue receiving money from these companies.
Zelenskyy's election campaign had centred on pledges to clean up the government of Ukraine.
Zelenskyy was inaugurated on 20 May 2019: Various foreign officials attended the inauguration ceremony in Ukraine's parliament.
Salome Zourabichvili attended the inauguration ceremony.
Kersti Kaljulaid attended the inauguration ceremony.
Raimonds Vējonis attended the inauguration ceremony.
Dalia Grybauskaitė attended the inauguration ceremony.
János Áder attended the inauguration ceremony.
Maroš Šefčovič attended the inauguration ceremony.
Rick Perry attended the inauguration ceremony.
Zelenskyy is the first Jewish president of Ukraine.
With Volodymyr Groysman as prime minister, Ukraine became the first country other than Israel to simultaneously have a Jewish head of state and head of government.
In his inaugural address, Zelenskyy diss: In his inaugural address, Zelenskyy dissolved the then Ukrainian parliament.
Zelenskyy called for early parliamentary elections.
One of the parliamentary coalition members, the People's Front, opposed the move.
The People's Front withdrew from the ruling coalition.
On 28 May, Zelenskyy restored the Ukrain: The event took place on 28 May.
The person whose citizenship was restored is Mikheil Saakashvili.
Zelenskyy's first major proposal to chan: Zelenskyy's first major proposal was to change the electoral system from a plurality voting system to proportional representation with closed party lists.
The Ukrainian parliament strongly rejected Zelenskyy's proposal.
The Ukrainian parliament believed that closed lists would lead to more corruption in government.
Zelenskyy had earlier called for the introduction of open list election ballots.
Zelenskyy mentioned the introduction of open list election ballots during his inauguration speech.
Zelenskyy's proposal would have held the 2019 Ukrainian parliamentary election with closed lists.
The reasoning for holding the 2019 election with closed lists was that the 60-day term to the snap election did not leave any chances for the introduction of the open list system.
In addition, on 6 June, lawmakers refuse: On 6 June, lawmakers refused to include Zelenskyy's key initiative on reintroducing criminal liability for illegal enrichment in the parliament's agenda.
Instead, lawmakers included a similar bill proposed by a group of deputies.

In June 2019, it was announced that the president's third major initiative, which seeks to remove immunity from lawmakers, diplomats, and judges, would be submitted after the July 2019 Ukrainian parliamentary election.
The initiative to remove immunity from lawmakers, diplomats, and judges was completed on 3 September.
On 3 September, the new parliament passed a bill stripping lawmakers of legal immunity.
The passing of the bill on 3 September delivered Zelenskyy a legislative victory.
The passing of the bill fulfilled one of Zelenskyy's key campaign promises.
On 8 July, Zelenskyy ordered the cancell: On 8 July, Zelenskyy ordered the cancellation of the annual Kyiv Independence Day Parade on Maidan Nezalezhnosti.
The cancellation was due to costs.
Zelenskyy highlighted that Independence Day would still 'honor heroes.'
The format of the celebration on Independence Day will be new.
Zelenskyy proposed to spend the money that would have been used to finance the parade on veterans.
In 2020, Zelenskyy's party proposed refo: In 2020, Zelenskyy's party proposed reforms to Ukraine's media laws.
The intent of the proposed reforms was to increase competition.
The reforms aimed to loosen the dominance of Ukrainian oligarchs on television and radio broadcasters.
Critics said the reforms risked increasing media censorship in Ukraine.
The clause of criminal responsibility for the distribution of disinformation could be abused, according to critics.
In January 2020, Zelenskyy took a trip t: In January 2020, Zelenskyy took a trip to Oman.
The trip to Oman was not published on Zelenskyy's official schedule.
The trip appeared to combine a personal holiday with government business.
Zelenskyy's office stated that he paid for the entire trip himself.
Zelenskyy was criticized for a lack of transparency regarding the trip.
Critics pointed out that Zelenskyy had once criticized his predecessor Poroshenko for taking an undisclosed vacation in the Maldives.
In January 2021, parliament passed a bil: In January 2021, parliament passed a bill updating and reforming Ukraine's referendum laws.
Ukraine's Constitutional Court had declared the previous referendum laws unconstitutional in 2018.
Fixing the referendum law had been one of Zelenskyy's campaign promises.
In June 2021, Zelenskyy submitted to the: In June 2021, Zelenskyy submitted to the Verkhovna Rada a bill creating a public registry of Ukraine's oligarchs.
The bill banned oligarchs from participating in privatizations of state-owned companies.
The bill forbade oligarchs from contributing financially to politicians.
Opposition party leaders supported Zelenskyy's goal of reducing oligarchs' influence on politics in Ukraine.
Opposition party leaders were critical of Zelenskyy's approach.
Opposition leaders said the public register would be dangerous as it concentrated power in the president.
Opposition leaders said the public register would be ineffective since oligarchs were merely a 'symbol' of more deeply-rooted corruption.
The bill was passed into law in September 2021.
Critics of Zelenskyy's administration have claimed he has sought to centralize authority.
Critics have claimed Zelenskyy has sought to strengthen his position by taking power away from the Ukrainian oligarchs.
Zelenskyy appointed Andriy Bohdan as hea: Zelenskyy appointed Andriy Bohdan as head of the Presidential Administration of Ukraine.
Before his appointment, Andriy Bohdan was the lawyer of Ukrainian oligarch Ihor Kolomoyskyi.
Under the rules of Lustration in Ukraine, introduced in 2014 following Euromaidan, Andriy Bohdan is not entitled to hold any state office until 2024.
Andriy Bohdan contended that heading the presidential administration is not considered civil service work, so lustration did not apply to him.
A number of members of the Presidential Administration appointed by Zelenskyy were former colleagues from his former production company, Kvartal 95.
Ivan Bakanov, a former colleague from Kvartal 95, became deputy head of the Ukrainian Secret Service.
Former deputy foreign minister Olena Zerkal declined an appointment as deputy head of the presidential administration.
Olena Zerkal agreed to serve as the Ukrainian representative of the international courts concerning Russia.
Zelenskyy's requests to replace the foreign minister, defence minister, chief prosecutor, and head of Ukraine's security service were rejected by parliament.
Zelenskyy dismissed and replaced 20 of the governors of Ukraine's 24 oblasts.
In the 21 July 2019 parliamentary electi: The parliamentary election took place on 21 July 2019.
Zelenskyy's political party is named Servant of the People.
Servant of the People won the first single-party majority in modern Ukrainian history in parliament.
Servant of the People received 43 percent of the party-list vote.
Servant of the People gained 254 of the 424 seats in parliament.
Following the elections, Zelenskyy nomin: Following the elections, Zelenskyy nominated Oleksiy Honcharuk as prime minister.
Oleksiy Honcharuk was quickly confirmed by parliament as prime minister.
Parliament confirmed Andrii Zahorodniuk as defence minister.
Parliament confirmed Vadym Prystaiko as foreign minister.
Parliament confirmed Bakanov as head of the SBU.
Arsen Avakov was kept on as interior minister.
Arsen Avakov is a controversial figure dogged by longstanding corruption allegations.
Honcharuk argued that the relatively inexperienced government needed experienced administrators.
Honcharuk stated that Avakov had been 'drawn red lines' that cannot be crossed.
Zelenskyy dismissed Bohdan as head of hi: Zelenskyy dismissed Bohdan as head of his presidential administration on 11 February 2020.
Zelenskyy appointed Andriy Yermak as head of his presidential administration on 11 February 2020.
Andriy Yermak succeeded Bohdan as head of Zelenskyy's presidential administration.
In March 2020, Honchurak resigned as pri: In March 2020, Honchurak resigned as prime minister.
Honchurak resigned following the leak of an audio recording.
In the audio recording, Honchurak appeared to belittle Zelenskyy's economic management.
Honchurak was replaced as prime minister by Denys Shmyhal.
Honchurak's hasty departure caused disquiet in Ukraine.
Honchurak's hasty departure caused disquiet abroad.
Many economists and political observers warned Honchurak's departure would bring instability.
In his 4 March address to the Rada, Zelenskyy recommitted to domestic reforms.
In his 4 March address to the Rada, Zelenskyy recommitted to financial reforms.
Zelenskyy remarked that he 'cannot always become a psychologist for people, a crisis manager for someone, a collector who requires honestly earned money, and a nanny of the ministry in charge.'
By September 2020, Zelenskyy's approval ratings had fallen to less than 32 percent.
On 24 March 2021, Zelenskyy signed Decre: Decree 117/2021 approves the 'strategy for de-occupation and reintegration of the temporarily occupied territory of the Autonomous Republic of Crimea and the city of Sevastopol.'
By October 2021, Zelenskyy's approval ra: By October 2021, Zelenskyy's approval rating had fallen to 24.7%.
Zelenskyy's approval rating in October 2021 was still above or on par with most of his predecessors' at the same point in their presidencies.
One of Zelenskyy's central campaign prom: Zelenskyy's central campaign promise was to end the Russo-Ukrainian War and resolve the Russia-sponsored separatist movement.
On 3 June, Zelenskyy appointed former president Leonid Kuchma as Ukraine's representative in the Tripartite Contact Group for a settlement in the conflict.
On 11 July 2019, Zelenskyy held his first telephone conversation with Russian president Vladimir Putin.
During the conversation, Zelenskyy urged Putin to enter into talks mediated by the EU.
Zelenskyy and Putin discussed the exchange of prisoners held by both sides.
In October 2019, Zelenskyy announced a preliminary deal with the separatists.
The deal involved the Ukrainian government respecting elections in the region in exchange for Russia withdrawing its unmarked troops.
The deal was met with heavy criticism and protests by both politicians and the Ukrainian public.
Detractors noted that elections in Donbas were unlikely to be free and fair.
Detractors claimed that separatists had driven most pro-Ukrainian residents out to ensure a pro-Russia majority.
Detractors believed it would be impossible to ensure Russia kept its end of the agreement.
Zelenskyy defended his negotiations, stating elections would not be held before a Russian withdrawal.
The agreement failed to ease the conflict.
The separatists continued their attacks.
Russia continued providing weapons and ammunition to the separatists.
Several Ukrainian nationalist militias and former militias refused to accept the agreement.
The far-right Azov fighters in the Luhansk region of Donbas were among those who refused the agreement.
Zelenskyy met with some of these groups to convince them to surrender their unregistered weapons and accept the peace accord.
Andriy Biletsky, leader of the far-right National Corps and first commander of Azov, accused Zelenskyy of being disrespectful to army veterans.
Biletsky accused Zelenskyy of acting on behalf of the Kremlin by leaving Ukrainians vulnerable to Russian aggression.
The peace deal ultimately failed to reduce the violence or end the war.
In December 2019, Russia and Ukraine agr: In December 2019, Russia and Ukraine agreed to resume talks mediated by France and Germany under the Normandy Format.
The Normandy Format had been abandoned in 2016.
The December 2019 meeting was Zelenskyy's first face-to-face meeting with Vladimir Putin.
In July 2020, Zelenskyy announced a formal ceasefire with the separatists.
The July 2020 ceasefire was the more than twentieth such attempt since the war began in 2014.
The ceasefire was frequently violated over the next few years.
Overall violence remained high despite the ceasefire.
Ceasefire violations in 2020 decreased by over 50 percent compared to the previous year.
On 8 January 2020, the Presidential Offi: On 8 January 2020, the Presidential Office announced that Volodymyr Zelenskyy was cutting short his trip to Oman.
The reason for Zelenskyy cutting short his trip was the Ukraine International Airlines Flight 752 plane crash in nearby Iran on the same day.
On the same day, internet news site Obozrevatel.com released information about Ukrainian politician Medvedchuk.
Medvedchuk is a member of the Opposition Platform — For Life and has exclusive relations with the current president of Russia.
Obozrevatel.com suggested that Medvedchuk may have arrived in Oman on 7 January 2020.
Rumors began that Zelenskyy may have had additional meetings in Oman besides the ones that were announced.
On 14 January 2020, Yermak dismissed the rumors as speculations and baseless conspiracy theories.
Medvedchuk stated that the plane was used by his older daughter's family to fly from Oman to Moscow.
Yermak later contacted the online newspaper Ukrainian Truth to provide more details about the visit to Oman and the plane crash in Iran.
On 17 January 2020, the presidential app: On 17 January 2020, the presidential appointee Minister of Foreign Affairs, Prystaiko, was unable to give answers during the 'times of questions to the government' in parliament.
The people's deputies of Ukraine asked Prystaiko about the visit's official agenda.
The people's deputies of Ukraine asked Prystaiko about the invitation from Oman.
The people's deputies of Ukraine asked Prystaiko about the officials of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs who were preparing the visit.
The people's deputies of Ukraine asked Prystaiko about how the president actually crossed the border while visiting Oman.
On 20 January 2020, Prystaiko gave a briefing to the press in the Office of the president of Ukraine.
Prystaiko said he would explain everything about the visit when the time came.
Zelenskyy's first official trip abroad a: Zelenskyy's first official trip abroad as president was to Brussels.
The trip took place in June 2019.
During the trip, Zelenskyy met with EU officials.
During the trip, Zelenskyy met with NATO officials.
In August 2019, Zelenskyy promised to li: In August 2019, Zelenskyy promised to lift the moratorium on exhuming Polish mass graves in Ukraine.
The previous Ukrainian government banned the Polish side from carrying out any exhumations of Polish victims of the Ukrainian Insurgent Army-perpetrated Volhynian massacres.
The ban followed the removal of a memorial to the Ukrainian Insurgent Army in Hruszowice, southeastern Poland.
In September 2019, it was reported that: In September 2019, it was reported that U.S. president Trump had allegedly blocked payment of a congressionally mandated $400-million military aid package to Ukraine.
The alleged blocking of the aid was to pressure Zelenskyy during a July phone call between the two presidents.
The pressure was allegedly to investigate alleged wrongdoing by Joe Biden and his son Hunter Biden.
Hunter Biden took a board seat on Ukrainian natural gas company Burisma Holdings.
This report was the catalyst for the Trump–Ukraine scandal.
The report led to the impeachment inquiry against Donald Trump.
Zelenskyy has denied that he was pressured by Trump.
Zelenskyy declared that 'he does not want to interfere in a foreign election.'
On a trip to the United States in Septem: In September 2021, Zelenskyy went on a trip to the United States.
Zelenskyy engaged in talks and commitments with U.S. President Joe Biden.
Zelenskyy engaged in talks and commitments with Secretary of Defense Lloyd Austin.
Zelenskyy engaged in talks and commitments with Secretary of Energy Jennifer Granholm.
Zelenskyy engaged in talks and commitments with Secretary of State Antony Blinken.
President Zelenskyy and First Lady Olena Zelenska participated in the opening of the Ukrainian House in Washington, D.C.
During the same trip, Zelenskyy met with Apple CEO Tim Cook.
Zelenskyy met with Ukrainians in senior positions at Silicon Valley tech companies.
While Zelenskyy was still in the U.S., an assassination attempt was made in Ukraine on Shefir, his closest aide.
Shefir was unhurt in the attack.
Shefir's driver was hospitalized with three bullet wounds.
In April 2021, in response to Russian mi: In April 2021, there was a Russian military build-up at the Ukrainian borders.
In April 2021, Zelenskyy spoke to American president Joe Biden.
In April 2021, Zelenskyy urged NATO members to speed up Ukraine's request for membership.
On 26 November 2021, Zelenskyy accused R: On 26 November 2021, Zelenskyy accused Russia and Ukrainian oligarch Rinat Akhmetov of backing a plan to overthrow his government.
Russia denied any involvement in a coup plot.
Rinat Akhmetov said in a statement that the information made public by Volodymyr Zelenskiy about attempts to draw him into some kind of coup is an absolute lie.
Akhmetov expressed outrage over the spread of this lie, regardless of the president's motives.
In December 2021, Zelenskyy called for preemptive action against Russia.
On 19 January 2022, Zelenskyy said in a video message that the country's citizens should not panic.
Zelenskyy appealed to the media to be methods of mass information and not mass hysteria.
On 28 January, Zelenskyy called on the West not to create a panic in his country over a potential Russian invasion.
Zelenskyy added that constant warnings of an imminent threat of invasion are putting the economy of Ukraine at risk.
Zelenskyy said that they do not see a bigger escalation than in early 2021 when Russia's military build-up started.
Zelenskyy and U.S. president Joe Biden disagreed on how imminent the threat was.
On 19 February, as worries of a Russian: On 19 February, concerns about a Russian invasion of Ukraine were increasing.
Zelenskyy warned the Munich Security Conference about the situation.
Zelenskyy urged Western nations to abandon their 'appeasement' attitude toward Moscow.
Ukraine had been granted security assurances in exchange for giving up the world's third-largest nuclear arsenal.
Ukraine does not have any firearms.
Zelenskyy stated that Ukraine has the right to urge a transformation from an appeasement policy to one that ensures security and peace.
In the early hours of 24 February, short: In the early hours of 24 February, shortly before the start of the Russian invasion, Zelenskyy recorded an address to the citizens of both Ukraine and Russia.
Zelenskyy disputed claims of the Russian government about the presence of neo-Nazis in the Ukrainian government.
Zelenskyy stated that he had no intention of attacking the Donbas region.
Zelenskyy highlighted his connections to the Donbas area.
In part of the address, Zelenskyy spoke in Russian to the people of Russia.
Zelenskyy appealed to the Russian people to pressure their leadership to prevent war.
Zelenskyy stated that people would suffer the most from the war.
Zelenskyy emphasized that regular people do not want war.
Zelenskyy suggested that regular people can prevent the war.
Zelenskyy mentioned various groups of people, including public figures, journalists, musicians, actors, athletes, scientists, doctors, bloggers, stand-up comedians, Tik-Tokers, and many more.
Zelenskyy compared regular people in Russia to those in Ukraine.
Zelenskyy expressed doubt that his appeal would be shown on Russian television.
Zelenskyy insisted that the citizens of Russia must see his appeal and know the truth.
Zelenskyy stated that the situation needs to stop before it is too late.
Zelenskyy suggested that if the Russian leadership does not want to negotiate for peace with Ukraine, they might negotiate with their own citizens.
Zelenskyy questioned whether Russians want war.
Zelenskyy stated that the answer to whether Russians want war depends on the citizens of the Russian Federation.
The speech was widely described as \"emo: The speech was widely described as 'emotional.'
The speech was widely described as 'astonishing.'
On the morning of 24 February, Putin ann: On the morning of 24 February, Putin announced that Russia was initiating a 'special military operation' in the Donbas.
Russian missiles struck a number of military targets in Ukraine.
Zelenskyy announced that diplomatic relations with Russia were being severed, effective immediately.
Later in the day on 24 February, Zelenskyy announced general mobilisation.
On 25 February, Zelenskyy said that despite Russia's claim that it was targeting only military sites, civilian sites were also being hit.
In an early morning address on 25 February, Zelenskyy said that his intelligence services had identified him as Russia's top target.
Zelenskyy stated that he is staying in Kyiv and his family will remain in the country.
Zelenskyy said, 'They want to destroy Ukraine politically by destroying the head of state.'

In the early hours of 26 February, during the most significant assault by Russian troops on the capital of Kyiv, the United States government and Turkish president Recep Tayyip Erdoğan urged Zelenskyy to evacuate to a safer location.
The United States and Turkey both offered assistance for Zelenskyy's evacuation.
Zelenskyy turned down both offers and opted to remain in Kyiv with its defense forces.
Zelenskyy said, 'The fight is here; I need ammunition, not a ride.'
More than 90% of Ukrainians supported th: More than 90% of Ukrainians supported the actions of Zelenskyy.
More than 90% of people in western Ukraine supported the actions of Zelenskyy.
More than 90% of people in central Ukraine supported the actions of Zelenskyy.
More than 80% of people in Russian-speaking regions in eastern Ukraine supported the actions of Zelenskyy.
More than 80% of people in Russian-speaking regions in southern Ukraine supported the actions of Zelenskyy.
A Pew Research Center poll found that 72% of Americans had confidence in Zelenskyy's handling of international affairs.
Zelenskyy has gained worldwide recogniti: Zelenskyy has gained worldwide recognition as the wartime leader of Ukraine during the Russian invasion.
Historian Andrew Roberts compared Zelenskyy to Winston Churchill.
Harvard Political Review stated that Zelenskyy has harnessed the power of social media to become history's first truly online wartime leader.
Zelenskyy bypasses traditional gatekeepers by using the internet to reach out to the people.
Zelenskyy has been described as a national hero or a 'global hero' by many commentators.
Publications such as The Hill, Deutsche Welle, Der Spiegel, and USA Today have described Zelenskyy as a hero.
BBC News and The Guardian have reported that Zelenskyy's response to the invasion has received praise even from previous critics.
During the invasion, Zelenskyy has reportedly been the target of more than a dozen assassination attempts.
Three assassination attempts on Zelenskyy were prevented by tips from Russian FSB employees who opposed the invasion.
Two assassination attempts on Zelenskyy were carried out by the Wagner Group, a Russian paramilitary force.
One assassination attempt on Zelenskyy was carried out by the Kadyrovites, the personal guard of Chechen leader Ramzan Kadyrov.
Zelenskyy stated that Ukrainian civilians were killed by Russian forces.

Zelenskyy said: 'We will not forgive. We will not forget. We will punish everyone who committed atrocities in this war... We will find every scum who was shelling our cities, our people, who was shooting the missiles, who was giving orders. You will not have a quiet place on this earth – except for a grave.'
On 7 March 2022, Czech president Milo\u0: On 7 March 2022, Czech president Miloš Zeman decided to award Zelenskyy with the highest state award of the Czech Republic.
The highest state award of the Czech Republic is the Order of the White Lion.
Zelenskyy was awarded for his bravery and courage.
The award was given in the context of Russia's invasion.
Zelenskyy has repeatedly called for dire: Zelenskyy has repeatedly called for direct talks with Putin.

Zelenskyy said: 'Good Lord, what do you want? Leave our land. If you don't want to leave now, sit down with me at the negotiating table. But not from 30 meters away, like with Macron and Scholz. I don't bite.'
Zelenskyy said he was '99.9 percent sure' that Putin thought the Ukrainians would welcome the invading forces with 'flowers and smiles.'
On 7 March 2022, as a condition for endi: On 7 March 2022, the Kremlin demanded Ukraine's neutrality as a condition for ending the invasion.
The Kremlin demanded recognition of Crimea as Russian territory.
The Kremlin demanded recognition of the self-proclaimed separatist republics of Donetsk and Luhansk as independent states.
On 8 March 2022, Zelenskyy expressed willingness to discuss Putin's demands.
Zelenskyy said he is ready for dialogue, but 'not for capitulation.'
Zelenskyy proposed a new collective security agreement for Ukraine with the United States, Turkey, France, and Germany as an alternative to joining NATO.
Zelenskyy's Servant of the People party said that Ukraine would not give up its claims on Crimea, Donetsk, and Luhansk.
Zelenskyy said that Ukraine was considering giving the Russian language protected minority status.
On 15 March 2022, Polish Prime Minister: On 15 March 2022, Polish Prime Minister Mateusz Morawiecki visited Kyiv.
On 15 March 2022, Czech Prime Minister Petr Fiala visited Kyiv.
On 15 March 2022, Slovenian Prime Minister Janez Janša visited Kyiv.
The purpose of the visit was to meet with Zelenskyy in a display of support for Ukraine.
On 16 March 2022, a deepfake appeared online of Zelenskyy calling on Ukrainian citizens to surrender to Russia.
The deepfake attack was largely deemed to have failed at its intended goal.
The video is considered to be the first use of deepfake technology in a global-scale disinformation attack.
Zelenskyy has made an effort to rally th: Zelenskyy has made an effort to rally the governments of Western nations to isolate Russia.
Zelenskyy has made numerous addresses to the legislature of the EU.
Zelenskyy has made numerous addresses to the legislature of the UK.
Zelenskyy has made numerous addresses to the legislature of Poland.
Zelenskyy has made numerous addresses to the legislature of Australia.
Zelenskyy has made numerous addresses to the legislature of Canada.
Zelenskyy has made numerous addresses to the legislature of the US.
Zelenskyy has made numerous addresses to the legislature of Germany.
Zelenskyy has made numerous addresses to the legislature of Israel.
Zelenskyy has made numerous addresses to the legislature of Italy.
Zelenskyy has made numerous addresses to the legislature of Japan.
Zelenskyy has made numerous addresses to the legislature of the Netherlands.
Zelenskyy has made numerous addresses to the legislature of Romania.
Zelenskyy has made numerous addresses to the legislatures of the Nordic countries.
On 23 March, Zelenskyy was calling on Ru: On 23 March, Zelenskyy was calling on Russians to emigrate from Russia to avoid financing the war in Ukraine with their taxes.
In March 2022, Zelenskyy supported the suspension of 11 Ukrainian political parties with ties to Russia.

The suspended parties include the Socialist Party of Ukraine, Derzhava, Left Opposition, Nashi, Opposition Bloc, Opposition Platform — For Life, Party of Shariy, Progressive Socialist Party of Ukraine, Union of Leftists, and the Volodymyr Saldo Bloc.
The Communist Party of Ukraine, another pro-Russia party, had already been banned in 2015 because of its support to the Donbas separatists.
Zelenskyy has supported consolidating all TV news stations into a single 24-hour news broadcast run by the state of Ukraine during martial law.
In April 2022, Zelenskyy criticized Germ: In April 2022, Zelenskyy criticized Germany's ties with Russia.
In May 2022, Zelenskyy said that Ukrainian men of conscription age had a duty to remain in Ukraine.
In February 2022, Zelenskyy ordered a general military mobilization.
In February 2022, Zelenskyy banned men aged 18 to 60 from leaving Ukraine.
Zelenskyy denounced suggestions by forme: Zelenskyy denounced suggestions by former US diplomat Henry Kissinger that Ukraine should cede control of Crimea and Donbas to Russia in exchange for peace.
On 25 May 2022, Zelenskyy said that Ukraine would not agree to peace until Russia agreed to return Crimea and the Donbas region to Ukraine.
Zelenskyy later said he did not believe that all the land seized by Russia since 2014, which includes Crimea, could be recaptured by force.
Zelenskyy stated, 'If we decide to go that way, we will lose hundreds of thousands of people.'
On 3 May 2022, Zelenskyy accused Turkey of having 'double standards' by welcoming Russian tourists while attempting to act as an intermediary between Russia and Ukraine to end the war.
On 25 May 2022, Zelenskyy said that he was satisfied with China's policy of staying away from the conflict.
In August 2022, Zelenskyy said China had the economic leverage to pressure Putin to end the war.

Zelenskyy added, 'I'm sure that without the Chinese market for the Russian Federation, Russia would be feeling complete economic isolation. That's something that China can do – to limit the trade until the war is over.'
According to Zelenskyy, since the beginn: Zelenskyy stated that since the beginning of the invasion, Chinese President Xi Jinping had refused to speak with him.
On 30 May 2022, Zelenskyy criticized EU: On 30 May 2022, Zelenskyy criticized EU leaders for being too soft on Russia.
Zelenskyy asked why Russia can still earn almost a billion euros a day by selling energy.

A study published by the Centre for Research on Energy and Clean Air calculates that the EU paid Russia about €56 billion for fossil fuel deliveries in the three months following the start of Russia's invasion.
On 20 June 2022, Zelenskyy addressed Afr: On 20 June 2022, Zelenskyy addressed African Union representatives via videoconference.
Zelenskyy invited African leaders to a virtual meeting.
Only four African leaders attended the virtual meeting.
On 20 July 2022, South America's Mercosur trade bloc refused Zelenskyy's request to speak at the trade bloc's summit in Paraguay.
Speaking about the 2022 Russian mobiliza: Zelenskyy called on Russians to not submit to 'criminal mobilization.'
Zelenskyy stated that Russian commanders do not care about the lives of Russians.
Zelenskyy claimed that Russian commanders just need to replenish the empty spaces left by killed and wounded Russian soldiers.
Putin announced Russia annexing four regions of Ukrainian territory it had seized during its invasion.
Zelenskyy announced that Ukraine would not hold peace talks with Russia while Putin was president.
On 25 September 2022, Zelenskyy said tha: On 25 September 2022, Zelenskyy said that Putin's threats to use nuclear weapons 'could be a reality.'
Zelenskyy added that Putin 'wants to scare the whole world' with nuclear blackmail.
Zelenskyy said that Putin is aware that the 'world will never forgive' a Russian nuclear strike.
Zelenskyy was asked about the future relationship between Ukrainians and Ukraine with Russia after the war.
Zelenskyy replied that 'They took too many people, too many lives. The society will not forgive them.'
Zelenskyy added that 'It will be the choice of our society whether to talk to them, or not to talk at all, and for how many years, tens of years or more.'
On 21 December 2022, Zelenskyy visited the United States on his first foreign trip since the war began.
Zelenskyy met with President Joe Biden during his visit to the United States.
Zelenskyy addressed Congress and delivered his full speech in English.
The United States announced they would supply Patriot missiles to Ukraine as had been requested.
By 31 December the Battle of Soledar had: The Battle of Soledar had been decided by 31 December.
On 16 January 2023, Russian forces secured control of the town of Soledar.
In early 2023, Zelenskyy signed a new la: In early 2023, Zelenskyy signed a new law declaring that desertion, or 'failure to report for duty without a valid reason,' would result in up to 12 years in prison.
Over a year later in late 2024, the Verkhovna Rada passed bills decriminalising soldiers' first instance of desertion or absence without leave if they returned to their duty station.
The Verkhovna Rada passed bills allowing soldiers who returned to their duty station after desertion or absence without leave to return to military service.
In May 2023, he visited the Internationa: In May 2023, he visited the International Criminal Court in The Hague.
He said he would like to see Putin stand trial for war crimes committed during the war in Ukraine.
He mentioned the crime of aggression as part of the war crimes.
By 1 June the Battle of Bakhmut had been: The Battle of Bakhmut was decided by 1 June.
The Battle of Bakhmut was decided in Russia's favour.
On 19 September 2023, in a speech to the: On 19 September 2023, Zelenskyy gave a speech to the UN General Assembly.
In his speech, Zelenskyy called on neutral countries in Latin America, Africa, and Asia to abandon their neutrality.
Zelenskyy urged these countries to support Ukraine.
In October 2023, after the Hroza missile attack, Zelenskyy criticized countries supporting Russia.
Zelenskyy stated that 'all those who help Russia circumvent sanctions are criminals.'
On 8 February 2024 Zelenskyy decommissio: On 8 February 2024, Zelenskyy decommissioned General Valery Zaluzhny as Commander-in-Chief of the Ukrainian Armed Forces.
Zelenskyy promoted General Oleksandr Syrskyi as the new Commander-in-Chief of the Ukrainian Armed Forces.
On 17 February 2024, General Oleksandr Syrskyi declared he would hold Avdiivka no longer.
On 25 June 2024 Zelenskyy decommissioned: On 25 June 2024, Zelenskyy decommissioned LtGen Yuriy Sodol.
LtGen Yuriy Sodol had been promoted in February to Syrskyi's now-vacant position.
Zelenskyy installed Brig Gen Andriy Hnatov to replace LtGen Yuriy Sodol.
In April 2024, Zelenskyy signed a new mo: In April 2024, Zelenskyy signed a new mobilization law to increase the number of troops.
Zelenskyy signed into law a measure lowering Ukraine's army mobilization age from 27 to 25.
In June 2024, Zelenskyy said that China': In June 2024, Zelenskyy said that China's support for Russia would prolong the war in Ukraine.
According to Zelenskyy, Russia used Chinese diplomats to undermine the Ukraine peace summit in Switzerland.
In July 2024, Zelenskyy criticised Naren: In July 2024, Zelenskyy criticised Narendra Modi's meeting with Putin.
The meeting between Modi and Putin occurred on the same day that Russian missile strikes hit the children's hospital Okhmatdyt in Kyiv.
Zelenskyy said it is a huge disappointment and a devastating blow to peace efforts to see the leader of the world’s largest democracy hug the world’s most bloody criminal in Moscow on such a day.
On 30 August 2024, Zelenskyy decommissio: On 30 August 2024, Zelenskyy decommissioned Lt Gen Mykola Oleshchuk.
Lt Gen Mykola Oleshchuk had headed the Ukrainian Air Force since 2021.
The decommissioning occurred shortly after the death of F-16 pilot Col Oleksiy Mes.
Col Oleksiy Mes died during a Russian missile attack.
Politician Maryana Bezuhla claimed the pilot's jet had been shot down by friendly fire.
The friendly fire was from an anti-aircraft missile.
The death of Col Oleksiy Mes is under investigation.
Zelenskyy did not specify a reason for Lt Gen Mykola Oleshchuk's dismissal.
Zelenskyy said 'we must...take care of all our warriors.'
Zelenskyy decided to replace the commander of the Air Forces the day after the pilot's death.
Zelenskyy expressed eternal gratitude to all military pilots.
In October 2024, Zelenskyy unveiled the: In October 2024, Zelenskyy unveiled the Victory Plan for Ukraine.
The Victory Plan for Ukraine included five points.
One point of the Victory Plan was geopolitical.
Two points of the Victory Plan were military.
One point of the Victory Plan was economical.
One point of the Victory Plan was related to national defense and safety.
In December 2024, Zelenskyy resisted pre: In December 2024, Zelenskyy resisted pressure from the Biden administration to lower the conscription age to 18 to replace Ukraine's battlefield losses.
In February 2025, Zelenskyy said that Ukraine would introduce special military contracts for volunteers aged 18 to 24.
On 4 September 2024, most of the Shmyhal: On 4 September 2024, most of the Shmyhal Government cabinet tendered their resignations.
Zelenskyy considered his reshuffle on 4 September 2024.
In February 2025, Zelenskyy met with U.S: In February 2025, Zelenskyy met with U.S. President Trump at the White House.
The purpose of the meeting was to discuss a proposed agreement.
The proposed agreement would give the United States the right to extract rare minerals from Ukrainian soil.
The meeting turned into a heated exchange.
Trump and Vice President Vance were against Zelenskyy during the exchange.
Zelenskyy was evicted from the White House.
In the aftermath of the meeting, the Tru: The Trump administration suspended provision of intelligence and military aid to Ukraine for around a week.
The provision of aid to Ukraine was resumed after Zelenskyy agreed to an unconditional 30-day ceasefire.
The 30-day ceasefire was contingent on Russian approval.
In a mid-June interview with BIHUS info: In mid-June, Andriy Herus gave an interview to BIHUS info.
Andriy Herus is a representative of the president of Ukraine at the Cabinet of Ministers.
Andriy Herus stated that Zelenskyy had never promised to lower communal tariffs.
A campaign video showed Zelenskyy stating that the price of natural gas in Ukraine could fall by 20–30 percent or maybe more.
Andriy Herus claimed that the statement in the campaign video was not a direct promise but 'half-hinting' and 'joking'.
Zelenskyy's election manifesto mentioned tariffs only once.
The manifesto stated that money raised from a capital amnesty would go towards 'lowering the tariff burden on low-income citizens'.
During his presidential campaign, Zelens: During his presidential campaign, Zelenskyy said that he supported Ukraine's becoming a member of the EU and NATO.
Zelenskyy said Ukrainian voters should decide on the country's membership of the EU and NATO in referendums.
Zelenskyy believed that the Ukrainian people had already chosen 'eurointegration.'
Zelenskyy's close advisor Bakanov said that Zelenskyy's policy is supportive of membership of both the EU and NATO.
Bakanov proposes holding referendums on membership of the EU and NATO.
Zelenskyy's electoral programme claimed that Ukrainian NATO membership is 'the choice of the Maidan and the course that is enshrined in the Constitution.'
Zelenskyy's electoral programme states that NATO membership is an instrument for strengthening Ukraine's defense capability.
The program states that Ukraine should set the goal to apply for a NATO Membership Action Plan in 2024.
The programme states that Zelenskyy 'will do everything to ensure' that Ukraine can apply for European Union membership in 2024.

Two days before the second round, Zelenskyy stated that he wanted to build 'a strong, powerful, free Ukraine, which is not the younger sister of Russia, which is not a corrupt partner of Europe, but our independent Ukraine.'
In October 2020, Zelenskyy spoke in support of Azerbaijan in regard to the Nagorno-Karabakh war.
Zelenskyy said, 'We support Azerbaijan's territorial integrity and sovereignty just as Azerbaijan always supports our territorial integrity and sovereignty.'
Zelenskyy has tried to position Ukraine: Zelenskyy has tried to position Ukraine as a neutral party in the political and trade tensions between the United States and China.
In January 2021, Zelenskyy said in an interview with Axios that he does not perceive China as a geopolitical threat.
Zelenskyy does not agree with the United States assertions that China represents a geopolitical threat.
In February 2022, he applied for Ukraine: In February 2022, he applied for Ukraine to join the EU.
Zelenskyy condemned Hamas' 7 October 202: Zelenskyy condemned Hamas' 7 October 2023 attack on Israel.
Zelenskyy expressed his support of Israel's right to self-defense.
As the Gaza war continued, Zelenskyy affirmed Ukraine's support for the two-state solution.
Zelenskyy recognized the State of Palestine.
Zelenskyy called for international law to be followed.
Zelenskyy expressed Ukraine's readiness to provide humanitarian aid to Gaza.
Zelenskyy expressed a desire to prevent civilian suffering.
Zelenskyy condemned the attempted assass: Zelenskyy condemned the attempted assassination of Donald Trump.
Zelenskyy supported the Euromaidan movem: Zelenskyy supported the Euromaidan movement in late 2013 and early 2014.
During the war in Donbas, Zelenskyy actively supported the Ukrainian army.
Zelenskyy helped fund a volunteer battalion fighting in Donbas.
In a 2014 interview with Komsomolskaya Pravda v Ukraine, Zelenskyy said he would have liked to visit Crimea but would avoid it because 'armed people are there.'
In August 2014, Zelenskyy performed for Ukrainian troops in Mariupol.
Zelenskyy's studio donated ₴1 million to the Ukrainian army.
Regarding the 2014 Russian annexation of Crimea, Zelenskyy said it would be possible to return Crimea to Ukrainian control only after a regime change in Russia.
In an interview in December 2018 with Uk: In December 2018, Zelenskyy gave an interview to Ukrainska Pravda.
Zelenskyy stated that as president he would try to end the ongoing war in Donbas by negotiating with Russia.
Zelenskyy considered the leaders of the Donetsk People's Republic and the Luhansk People's Republic to be Russia's 'puppets.'
Zelenskyy believed it would 'make no sense to speak with' the leaders of the Donetsk People's Republic and the Luhansk People's Republic.
Zelenskyy did not rule out holding a referendum on the issue of the war in Donbas.
Three days before the 2019 presidential election, Zelenskyy stated he was against granting the Donbas region 'special status.'
Zelenskyy said that if elected president, he would not sign a law on amnesty for the militants of the DPR and LPR.
In response to suggestions to the contra: In April 2019, he stated that he regarded Putin as an enemy.
On 2 May 2019, Zelenskyy wrote on Facebook that the border is the only thing Russia and Ukraine have in common.
Zelenskyy opposes the Nord Stream 2 natu: Zelenskyy opposes the Nord Stream 2 natural gas pipeline.
The Nord Stream 2 pipeline is between Russia and Germany.
Zelenskyy calls the Nord Stream 2 pipeline 'a dangerous weapon.'
Zelenskyy believes the pipeline is dangerous not only for Ukraine but for the whole of Europe.
On 25 May 2022, two months after the ful: The event occurred two months after the full-scale Russian invasion.
Zelenskyy made a statement on this date.
Zelenskyy said, 'Ukraine will fight until it regains all its territories.'
Zelenskyy has described the extensive en: Zelenskyy has described the extensive environmental damage from the war as 'an environmental bomb of mass destruction'.
Zelenskyy has described the extensive environmental damage from the war as 'an ecocide'.
Zelenskyy has met with prominent European politicians to discuss the environmental damage.
Zelenskyy has met with others to discuss the environmental damage.
During the 2019 presidential campaign, Z: During the 2019 presidential campaign, Zelenskyy promised bills to fight corruption.
Zelenskyy promised the removal of immunity from the president.
Zelenskyy promised the removal of immunity from members of the Verkhovna Rada.
Zelenskyy promised the removal of immunity from judges.
Zelenskyy promised a law about impeachment.
Zelenskyy promised reform of election laws.
Zelenskyy promised to provide efficient trial by jury.
Zelenskyy promised to bring the salary for military personnel to the level of NATO standards.
Although Zelenskyy had earlier stated th: Zelenskyy had earlier stated that he prefers elections with open list election ballots.
Zelenskyy called the snap 2019 Ukrainian parliamentary election.
Zelenskyy's draft law was titled 'On amendments to some laws of Ukraine in connection with the change of the electoral system for the election of people's deputies.'
The draft law proposed to hold the election with closed lists.
The reason for proposing closed lists was that the 60-day term to the snap election did not leave any chances for the introduction of the open list system.
The bill proposing closed lists was rejected by parliament.
Zelenskyy opposed targeting the Russian: Zelenskyy opposed targeting the Russian language in Ukraine.
Zelenskyy opposed banning artists for their political opinions.
In April 2019, Zelenskyy stated that he was not against a Ukrainian language quota.
Zelenskyy noted that the Ukrainian language quota could be tweaked.
Zelenskyy said that Russian artists 'who have turned into politicians' should remain banned from entering Ukraine.
In response to a petition demanding equa: Zelenskyy responded to a petition demanding equal rights for same-sex couples.
Zelenskyy affirmed that democracies are measured by how they ensure equal rights for all citizens.
Zelenskyy stated that 'all people are free and equal in their dignity and rights'.
Zelenskyy stated that the family 'consists of persons who live together, are connected by common life, have mutual rights and obligations'.
Zelenskyy asked the Prime Minister of Ukraine to review civil partnerships for same-sex couples.
Zelenskyy called the review of civil partnerships 'part of the work on establishing and ensuring human rights and freedoms'.
Zelenskyy said that same-sex marriage could not be introduced during wartime.
Introducing same-sex marriage would require amending the Constitution of Ukraine.
The Constitution of Ukraine defines marriage as 'based on the free consent of a woman and a man'.
The Constitution of Ukraine cannot be changed during martial law.
Civil rights organizations such as Kyiv Pride praised Zelenskyy's statement.
Holos MP Inna Sovsun criticized the lack of details about legal proposals for civil partnerships.
On 2 December 2022, Zelenskyy said his a: On 2 December 2022, Zelenskyy said his administration would enter a bill in the Verkhovna Rada.
The bill would ban religious organizations affiliated with centers of influence in the Russian Federation from operating in Ukraine.
The Ukrainian Orthodox Church is referred to in the context of the bill.
The bill was passed by parliament in August 2024.
Zelenskyy signed the bill in August 2024.
Opposition parties protested the bill's delay.
The law treats each parish individually.
Each parish is given nine months to cut ties with the UOC-MP.
A special commission will inspect individual parishes after the nine-month period.
The commission will file lawsuits against non-compliant parishes.
The court can decide on a ban in each case.
In September 2003, Zelenskyy married Ole: In September 2003, Zelenskyy married Olena Kiyashko.
Zelenskyy and Olena Kiyashko attended school and university together.
Olena Kiyashko worked as a scriptwriter at Kvartal 95.
The couple's first daughter, Oleksandra, was born in July 2004.
Their son, Kyrylo, was born in January 2013.
In Zelenskyy's 2014 movie 8 New Dates, their daughter played Sasha, the daughter of the protagonist.
In 2016, Oleksandra participated in the show Make the Comedian Laugh: Kids and won ₴50,000.
Zelenskyy's assets were worth about \u20: Zelenskyy's assets were worth about ₴37 million in 2018.
Zelenskyy's first language is Russian, a: Since becoming president, Zelenskyy has hired a Ukrainian-language tutor.
Zelenskyy has improved his command of the Ukrainian language since becoming president.
The Teletriumph Awards are the national: The Teletriumph Awards are the national television awards of Ukraine.
Zelenskyy has won the Teletriumph Award over 30 times.
Zelenskyy has won the Teletriumph Award in multiple categories.
Zelenskyy has won the Teletriumph Award in multiple years.
Teletriumph 2018 remains the most recent award year.
The Teletriumph Awards were cancelled in 2019 due to reorganizational efforts.
The Teletriumph Awards were cancelled again in 2020 due to COVID-19.
In 2021, Zelenskyy served on the 'Expert Council' of the Ukrainian Television Academy.
Zelenskyy was involved in overseeing the restructuring efforts of the Teletriumph Awards in 2021.
Zelenskyy was involved in discussions for a new nomination process for the Teletriumph Awards in 2021.
As the Ukrainian Television Academy was finalizing its award nominations for 2022, Russia invaded Ukraine.
Much of the celebrity class of Ukraine enlisted into the military after Russia invaded Ukraine.
The Teletriumph Awards are not considered permanently cancelled.
The Teletriumph Awards are indefinitely suspended.
In 2022, British newspaper Financial Tim: In 2022, British newspaper Financial Times selected Zelenskyy as Person of the Year.
In 2022, US magazine Time selected Zelenskyy as Person of the Year.
Ausichicrinites zelenskyyi , an extinct: Ausichicrinites zelenskyyi is an extinct species of feather star.
The species was described on 20 July 2022.
A group of Polish paleontologists described the species.
The species is named after Zelenskyy.
The naming honors Zelenskyy for his courage and bravery.
Zelenskyy is recognized for defending free Ukraine.
In 2023, American country music singer B: In 2023, Brad Paisley is an American country music singer.
In 2023, Brad Paisley released a song titled 'Same Here'.
The song 'Same Here' features Zelenskyy in a spoken-word interlude.
